analyst_prompt.content:
I want you to act as an analyst and help me analyze the given {analyse_type} {id} for the {task_type} task. IMPORTANT: All responses must be in Vietnamese (tiếng Việt). You can use 6 type of commands to do this:
(1) UserInfo[id], which returns the information of the user with the given id.
(2) ItemInfo[id], which returns the information of the item with the given id.
(3) UserHistory[id, k], which returns the interaction history of user id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(4) ItemHistory[id, k], which returns the interaction history of item id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(5) PredictRating[user_id, item_id], which predicts the rating a user would give to an item (only use this for rating prediction tasks).
(6) Finish[result], which finishes the task and returns the analyze result.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTION: When using UserHistory[id, k], you MUST set k=10. Example: UserHistory[821, 10]. Do NOT use k=3. I need at least 10 items to analyze preferences correctly.

For RATING PREDICTION tasks: If you have both user_id and item_id available (called with format Analyse[user, user_id, item, item_id]), IMMEDIATELY use PredictRating[user_id, item_id] to get the predicted rating, then Finish with just the numerical rating (e.g., Finish[4.2]). Do NOT analyze user history or item info - go straight to prediction!

You can take at most {max_step} steps.
Valid command examples:
{examples}
Here are some examples:
{fewshot}
(END OF EXAMPLES)

Remember the {analyse_type} id is {id}.

{history}

{hint}
Command:

analyst_prompt_json.content:
I want you to act as an analyst and help me analyze the given {analyse_type} {id} for the {task_type} task. IMPORTANT: All responses must be in Vietnamese (tiếng Việt). You can use 6 type of commands to do this in JSON format:
(1) {{"type": "UserInfo", "content": id}}, which returns the information of the user with the given id.
(2) {{"type": "ItemInfo", "content": id}}, which returns the information of the item with the given id.
(3) {{"type": "UserHistory", "content": [id, k]}}, which returns the interaction history of user id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(4) {{"type": "ItemHistory", "content": [id, k]}}, which returns the interaction history of item id before (at most k interactions will be returned).
(5) {{"type": "PredictRating", "content": [user_id, item_id]}}, which predicts the rating a user would give to an item (only use this for rating prediction tasks).
(6) {{"type": "Finish", "content": result}}, which finishes the task and returns the analyze result.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTION: When using UserHistory, you MUST set k=10. Example: {{"type": "UserHistory", "content": [821, 10]}}. Do NOT use k=3.

For RATING PREDICTION tasks: If you have both user_id and item_id available (called with format Analyse[user, user_id, item, item_id]), IMMEDIATELY use PredictRating[user_id, item_id] to get the predicted rating, then Finish with just the numerical rating (e.g., {{"type": "Finish", "content": 4.2}}). Do NOT analyze user history or item info - go straight to prediction!

You can take at most {max_step} steps.
Valid command examples:
{examples}
Here are some examples:
{fewshot}
(END OF EXAMPLES)

Remember the {analyse_type} id is {id}.

{history}

{hint}
Command:

analyst_examples.content:
UserInfo[123]
ItemInfo[456]
UserHistory[123, 10]
ItemHistory[456, 10]
PredictRating[123, 456]
Finish[4.2]

analyst_fewshot.content:
RATING PREDICTION SCENARIO (when called with user AND item):
Called as: Analyse[user, 123, item, 456]
Both user_id=123 and item_id=456 are available
IMMEDIATELY use: PredictRating[123, 456]
Then: Finish[4.2]

GENERAL ANALYSIS SCENARIO (when called with only user):
Called as: Analyse[user, 123]
Only user_id=123 available
Use: UserHistory[123, 10]
Then analyze preferences and recommend

SEPARATE ITEM ANALYSIS:
Called as: Analyse[item, 456]
Only item_id=456 available
Use: ItemInfo[456], ItemHistory[456, 10]
Then analyze item features

analyst_hint.content: This is the final step. You should use Finish command to finish the task.
